system.description: In contrast to the Cleric, the Magic-user possesses a personal spell book, which may not contain every spell from the standard lists. By reading from this book, the Magic-user imprints a chosen spell formula into her mind, “preparing” it for casting. Once a prepared spell is cast, its formula vanishes from her mind, requiring her to prepare it anew before it can be cast again. However, she can prepare the same spell multiple times, utilizing the available “slots” in her memory. Should the Magic-user discover spell scrolls during her adventures, she has the ability to transcribe them into her spell book.
